en: Espace Cyclosport Massif de l'Aigoual D1 : From L'Espérou or St Sauveur Camprieu, the route starts very gently because the first serious pass only arrives at the 65th km ! After Lanuejols, crossing the superb Causse Noir, before diving into Aveyron towards the village of Le Rozier. Then enter the majestic Gorges du Tarn, which you can admire for almost 20 km, passing through Les Vignes and La Malène. From this village, you will climb up to the Causse Méjean, an emblematic site that will take you through the village of La Parade and pass near the Dargilan cave. The descent to Meyrueis offers a beautiful view of the Aven Armand and the sublime Gorges de la Jonte! This first day ends, with more D- than D+...Note: Possibility to reduce the route to less than 70 km by going up the Jonte Gorges to Meyrueis from Les Roziers. Day 2: The tour of the Aigoual continues with the famous Perjuret pass and its descent into the history of the Tour de France. We then cross the charming villages of Vanels and Vebron before attacking the 2nd pass, the Solpérière pass, to join the cornice of the Cévennes with a beautiful descent to St-André-de-Valborgne via Pompidou. The 3rd difficulty of the day, the Salidès pass, is followed by the star of these 4 days, the summit of Mount Aigoual (1567m). The day ends with 30 km of wide and safe descent to Valleraugue. Note: Possibility to shorten the day to about 70 km, by turning towards Valleraugue to St-André-de-Valbrogne by the Pas pass. Day 3: The 3rd stage begins with the Col du Pas and its beautiful southern exposure, to be preferred in the morning "early" in summer. Then it's time for the "Cévennes slide" with the descent to Saumane via Les Plantiers, then Lasalle, passing through L'Estrechure and the Mercou pass. On the second part of the day, the typical Cevennes villages of Colognac, St-Roman-de- Codières, then St-Martial, follow one another and reach the Tribale pass. After a good descent and the crossing of the RD986, a last hill leads to St-André-de Majencoules, to finish more peacefully to Le Vigan. The total difference in altitude is again slightly negative, but it won't last until the end... Note: To reduce the distance to about 70 km, turn off at St-Roman-de-Codières towards Sumène, then Le Vigan. D4 : From Le Vigan, start the ascent in the direction of Mont Aigoual until the Col du Minier (1264m). Then take the pretty forest road (a bit chaotic, be careful) leading to the village of Dourbies. Enjoy the panorama of the Dourbie gorges until the Pierre Plantée pass, then turn towards the Trèves valley, until the superb perched village of Cantobre. Leaving the RD991, the road rises towards the beautiful village of Revens, and then allows you to cross the Causse Noir to Lanuéjols. The end of the journey passes through the village of Camprieu to reach the finish in L'Espérou. Note: It is possible to shorten the route to about 70 km by taking the direction of Camprieu from Trèves. Itinerant circuit over 4 days Departure: from each entrance of the Espace Cyclo SportDuration: 4 daysDistance: 395 kmAltitude gain: 7400 mThe route is available for free download and the topoguide is on sale for 3€ at the Mont Aigoual Causses Cévennes Tourist Offices.The "Pôle Nature 4 saisons du Massif de l'Aigoual" project is co-financed by the European Union. Europe is committed to the Massif Central with the European Regional Development Fund.
